title: I was served a court summons without a date by cach llc im being sued is it a real summons without a date
question: I lost my job paid on my credit cards until my unemployment ran out, Then I was diagnosed with ms cant work and get disability can they garnish my social security
answers:
CACH is a junk debt buyer that bought your account from the original creditor for pennies on the dollar and is now suing you for the full amount of the original debt. It is likely this company does not have the necessary documents to win this lawsuit. You must challenge it however. If you do challenge it, this lawsuit will likely be dismissed without you paying anything. while your social security is exempt from garnishment you do not need to have a judgment against you, if for no other reason than this company will not have the documents to win this case. If you do not respond to it they will win by default. Though they may not be able to garnish your benefits they can make you appear for depositions and answer questions about what assets you may have--right up to asking you if you have any money in your pocket.
You need to contact an attorney who handles these credit card lawsuit claims. Such an attorney will know exactly what the lawsuit is missing and how to have it dismissed. I suggest you go to the website for the National Association for Consumer Lawyers and use their lawyer search to find a lawyer near you. If you received letters from lawyers offering to help you on this claim, they probably handle a lot of these claims and can help you.

As for your concern about a summons without a date, do you mean there is no trial or hearing date given? That's the norm. The summons notifies you that you have been sued, and when it is properly served on you gives the court jurisdiction over you. The complaint spells out the bases for seeking to collect money from you. You must respond within 30 days of service of the summons or risk being defaulted. Although your Social Security income is exempt from enforcement of judgment, you would be better off not having a judgment against you at all--you might have other assets that could satisfy the judgment. Consult a local debt collection defense attorney to find out how best to proceed from this point on. Good luck.

The only date on the Summons will be the date when the Clerk issued the Summons. The date when you are served will not appear on the Summons. You have 30 days from the date when you were served, or from when the process server will claim that you were served.

If you do not respond by filing appropriate papers with the court, it may be very difficult for you to, later on, make a motion to vacate the default judgment.

The home page of my website, linked below, has several short videos on your options, when receiving a debt collection lawsuit. A formal response is due to be filed with the clerk of the court within 30 days of being served (see my blog, link below). That should be enough time to explore your options and consult with an experienced debt collection DEFENSE attorney and find out what that costs and what to expect. Even if you are unemployed, I recommend consulting with an attorney sooner rather than later, because a default judgment will hang over your head for many years if you don't do something about it.

Robert Stempler (please see DISCLAIMER below)
www.StopCollectionLawsuits.com
www.facebook.com/SoCalConsumerLawyer
Twitter: @RStempler

Not all summons will have a date. The Rules of Procedure dictate the deadline for a response.

Whether the summons will have a date is usually determined by which level of state court in which you are being sued. For example, in CO, if a person is sued in small claims or county court, the summons will have a date. If the person is sued in district court, the summons will not have a date.

CACH LLC is a real outfit and they sue. They may be slimy debt buyers, but they are a legitimate operation.

Cach LLC is a debt buyer. They buy a lot of charged off BofA cards. If the debt is large enough, you should consult with a bankruptcy or debt settlement attorney. If you don't respond to their lawsuit, they will get a default judgment and have different avenues of collection - wage garnishment being one. Social security is exempt from garnishment.
